events.message: I filed a claim today after my car was rear-ended at a traffic light; the damage looks extensive on the back bumper and trunk.
The insurance company has now categorised my claim as an auto accident, based on the vehicle collision details provided.
An agent has been assigned to handle my car accident claim and will be contacting me shortly for further information.
I received confirmation that the insurance company has acknowledged my auto accident claim and is starting the process.
The insurance agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and repair shop estimates to proceed with my claim.
I submitted all requested documents including accident photos, police report, and mechanicâ€™s repair estimate for the vehicle damage.
The insurance company started their investigation into the vehicle collision details and liability for the auto accident claim.
The investigation into the car accident has been completed, confirming that the other driver was at fault for the collision.
The insurance adjuster proposed a settlement offer to cover the repair costs and any rental car expenses incurred due to the accident.
I provided feedback expressing satisfaction with the quick response and thorough handling of my auto accident claim.
My auto accident claim was officially approved today, including coverage for damages and the rental car reimbursement.
The insurance company issued payment to the repair shop and reimbursed my rental car expenses promptly after claim approval.
The insurance company has closed my auto accident claim, confirming all repairs and payments have been completed successfully.
For record-keeping purposes, my completed auto accident claim case has been archived by the insurance provider.
